us.phonetic: /v. əˈsoʊʃiˌeɪt, -si-; n., adj., -ɪt, -ˌeɪt/, (v. ə sō′shē āt′, -sē-; n., adj., ə sō′shē it, -āt′, -sē-)

example.eg: For some reason, I associate Max with peanut butter.
example.egtrans: 不知道什么原因，我一看到花生酱就会联想到马克思。

example.eg: The two of them don't associate; they are actually enemies.
example.egtrans: 他们两个不交往; 他们实际上是敌人。

example.eg: This is a complicated case, so one of the associates will handle it.
example.egtrans: 这是一个复杂的案例，因此其中一位同事会处理它。

example.eg: An associate will be with you in a moment.
example.egtrans: 一位副手一会儿会和你一起。

example.eg: In their search for the criminal, the police are questioning his associates.
example.egtrans: 为了追捕罪犯，警方对其同伙开展了审讯。

example.eg: The firm, together with its associates, is working on creating good career opportunities for local people.
example.egtrans: 这家公司与多位合伙人携手合作，为当地人创造良好的就业机会。

example.eg: Ginny is an associate of the Royal Academy of Arts.
example.egtrans: 金妮是皇家艺术学院的准会员。

example.eg: The man in the striped shirt is the associate producer of the film.
example.egtrans: 那个穿着条纹衬衫的人是电影的副制作人。

us.phonetic: /v. əˈsoʊʃiˌeɪt, -si-; n., adj., -ɪt, -ˌeɪt/, (v. ə sō′shē āt′, -sē-; n., adj., ə sō′shē it, -āt′, -sē-)

example.eg: The former C.E.O. and a manager associated to form a new company.

us.phonetic: /v. əˈsoʊʃiˌeɪt, -si-; n., adj., -ɪt, -ˌeɪt/, (v. ə sō′shē āt′, -sē-; n., adj., ə sō′shē it, -āt′, -sē-)

example.eg: I don't want you to associate with him; he's not good for you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…打交道, 和…来往, 联系

us.phonetic: /v. əˈsoʊʃiˌeɪt, -si-; n., adj., -ɪt, -ˌeɪt/, (v. ə sō′shē āt′, -sē-; n., adj., ə sō′shē it, -āt′, -sē-)

example.eg: For an associate degree, it's not unusual for students to study part time.
example.egtrans: 攻读专科学位的学生经常是非全日制学习。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大专文凭, 两年制的专科学位

example.eg: She got tenure when she was promoted to associate professor.
The sales associate helped the customer pick out and buy the product he needed.
